docs.title: SOP: Change Device Name from UBIQCM4XXX to JTURPCM4XXX
Purpose
docs.text:
This document explains, in simple and clear terms, how to: - Change the device name from UBIQCM4XXX to JTURPCM4XXX - Remove Remoteit software from the device - Update the device software (UB_JTEDS) - Verify SIM card and 4G internet connectivity - Change the device hostname

This guide is written so that a person with minimal technical knowledge can follow it step by step.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Before starting, ensure the following: - Laptop or PC (Windows, Linux, or macOS) - Internet connection - Device powered on - Device connected to the internet (hotspot or LAN) - Device IP address - UB_JTEDS folder available on the PC

docs.title: Step 1: Connect to the Device Using SSH
docs.text: SSH allows you to log in to the device remotely using a command line.

docs.title: Open Terminal or Command Prompt
docs.text:
• Windows: Command Prompt or PowerShell
  • Linux / macOS: Terminal

docs.title: Login Command
docs.text:
ssh UbiqCM4@<DEVICE_IP>

Example: 

ssh UbiqCM4@192.168.1.25

If prompted: - Type yes - Enter the device password

UbiqCM4

You are now logged into the device.

docs.title: Backup Existing Software
docs.text:
Run the following command on the device: 

mv UB_JTEDS UB_JTEDS_backup
This keeps a backup of the existing software.

docs.title: Copy New UB_JTEDS from PC to Device
docs.text:
On the PC terminal:

In case of Linux 

cd ~/Desktop
scp -r UB_JTEDS UbiqCM4@<DEVICE_IP>:/home/UbiqCM4/

In case of Windows

scp -r "Add UB_JTEDS file location followed by file name " UbiqCM4@<DEVICE_IP>:/home/UbiqCM4/
Example : 
scp -r "C:\Users\Admin\OneDrive\Desktop\UB_JTEDS" UbiqCM4@<DEVICE_IP>:/home/UbiqCM4/
Refer the screenshot for more information

Wait until the copy process completes.

docs.title: Set Correct Permissions
docs.text:
Log in to the device and run: 

cd /home/UbiqCM4
chmod -R 755 UB_JTEDS
This will have no output

docs.title: Step 3 : Correct your main.service(Most Important to get the data in JT Portal)
Edit the service file
docs.text: sudo systemctl edit --full main

docs.title: Replace the [Service] section with THIS
docs.text:
[Unit]
Description=Main Python Script Service
After=network.target pigpiod.service
Requires=pigpiod.service

[Service]
Type=simple
User=UbiqCM4

WorkingDirectory=/home/UbiqCM4/UB_JTEDS
ExecStart=/usr/bin/python3 /home/UbiqCM4/UB_JTEDS/main.py

Restart=on-failure
RestartSec=5

StandardOutput=journal
StandardError=journal

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

docs.title: Apply changes (DON’T SKIP)
docs.text:
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl restart main

docs.title: Check
docs.text:
systemctl status main
journalctl -u main -f

docs.title: Update Device Packages
docs.text:
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y
This might take some time

Check for running Remoteit services

docs.title: Stop Remote.it Services
docs.text:
sudo systemctl stop remoteit
sudo systemctl stop demuxer
sudo systemctl stop schannel

docs.title: Disable Remote.it Services at Boot
docs.text:
sudo systemctl disable remoteit
sudo systemctl disable demuxer
sudo systemctl disable schannel

docs.title: Remove Remote.it Completely
docs.text:
sudo apt purge remoteit -y
sudo rm -rf /usr/share/remoteit
sudo rm -rf /etc/remoteit

docs.title: Verify Removal
docs.text:
ps aux | grep remoteit
If no output appears or the output is something like the screenshot below , Remoteit has been successfully removed.

docs.title: Step 5: Restart Device Services
docs.text:
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl restart main
sudo systemctl restart system_control
sudo systemctl restart logged_data_sync
sudo systemctl restart handle_4G
This will have no output.

docs.title: Verify Software Operation
docs.text:
journalctl -u main -f

Expected output: 

Connected to MQTT broker and No sensor output.

docs.title: Step 6: Update Device Access Token
docs.text:
Navigate inside UB_JTEDS :

cd UB_JTEDS
Open the access_token.json file :

sudo nano access_token.json

Old format: 

UbiqCM4@XXX

New format: 

JturpCM4@XXX
Note: Please write the access token on the box with marker.

docs.title: Step 7: Verify SIM Card and 4G Connectivity
docs.text:
python3 handle_4G.py

Expected output: 

VI APN configured
Internet connected
4G modem & usb0 detected

docs.title: If that doesn't work then follow this
docs.text:
python3 fetch_sim_info.py

Expected output: 

SIM info

docs.title: Check Current Hostname
docs.text: hostnamectl

docs.title: Set New Hostname
docs.text:
sudo hostnamectl set-hostname JTURPCM4XXX

Example: 

sudo hostnamectl set-hostname JTURPCM4268

docs.title: Reboot the CM4
docs.text: sudo reboot

docs.title: Update Hosts File
docs.text:
sudo nano /etc/hosts

Change: 

127.0.1.1    CM4268

To: 

127.0.1.1    JTURPCM4XXX

Save and exit: - CTRL + O, then Enter - CTRL + X

docs.title: Reboot the Device
docs.text:
This will restart the system from software and hardware both 

sudo reboot

Wait approximately two minutes, then power the device off and on again.

docs.title: 9. Install Tailscale (Remote Access)
docs.text:
Download the Statis Binary file named : arm64: tailscale_1.94.2_arm64.tgz (This should be on download)

Copy file to device:

scp tailscale_1.94.2_arm64.tgz UbiqCM4@<DEVICE_IP>:~

Extract the tgz file and navigate to that folder :

tar -xvzf tailscale_1.94.2_arm64.tgz
cd tailscale_1.94.2_arm64

Install:

sudo cp tailscale /usr/local/bin/
sudo cp tailscaled /usr/local/sbin/
sudo chmod 755 /usr/local/bin/tailscale
sudo chmod 755 /usr/local/sbin/tailscaled
sudo cp tailscaled /usr/local/sbin/
sudo chmod 755 /usr/local/sbin/tailscaled
sudo chmod 755 /usr/local/bin/tailscale
Check the version to tailscale this will ensure that tailscale is installed properly:

tailscale version
Create service:

sudo nano /etc/systemd/system/tailscaled.service

Paste:

[Unit]
Description=Tailscale node agent
After=network.target

[Service]
Type=simple
ExecStart=/usr/local/sbin/tailscaled
Restart=always
RestartSec=5

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

Start:

sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/tailscale
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl enable tailscaled
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl reset-failed
sudo systemctl restart tailscaled

Check the status of Tailscaled:

systemctl status tailscaled

It should show Runnning.

Start the tainet channel: 

sudo tailscale up
Approve device in browser.

Get remote IP:

tailscale ip -4

Remote SSH from anywhere:

ssh UbiqCM4@100.x.x.x

docs.title: Optional: Copy Code from Device to PC
docs.text: scp -r UbiqCM4@<DEVICE_IP>:/home/UbiqCM4/UB_JTEDS ~/Desktop/

docs.title: Final Technician Checklist (MANDATORY)
docs.text:
• Write the device Access Token on device body using permanent marker
  • Label the SIM card as JT
  • Note the Tailscale IP in deployment sheet
  • Verify remote SSH login works
  • Confirm data visible in JT portal

docs.title: Deployment Complete
docs.text: Device is now ready for field installation and remote maintenance.
